attributes.action: Put warning labels on food products to combat waste and climate change
attributes.background: We should take a stronger stance against key day-to-day contributors to climate change, such as food waste, high meat consumption and single-use plastic. By reminding people constantly, we will be treating climate change and unsustainable lifestyle as seriously as we treated smoking.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside the immediate effect of warning labels lowering unsustainably high demand for these products, this legislation would also contribute to creating a more conscientious mindset around collective resources. As a society, we eat meat too much, we waste around 30% of food, and we use too much packaging.

Sure, individuals can financially afford to be wasteful or over-indulgent, but it doesn't mean we can collectively afford it in the long-term. Future wars will hurt us if we don't act.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584505

attributes.action: Make E scooters legal on bike lanes
attributes.background:
As e scooters are illegal 
And they are more efficient to the country 
Why can’t we have a limit on speed then allow them to go in bike lnes.  Already London have scooter trials. But why can’t we take our own scooters. To the roads.  
Helps climate change 
Pollution 
And emissions
attributes.additional_details:
As it will make the planet more green 
And safe. More better London

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Legalize the use of e-scooters where bikes can be used: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583107

Allow E-scooters and Electric Skateboards in cycle lanes and on roads: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578486

attributes.action: Address global crises of overfishing which could empty the seas by 2048.
attributes.background: 90% of the world’s large fish have been wiped out by commercial fishing. Ban UK battery fish farms, and reassess the £23million funding scheme to support UK fishing exports to the EU which contributes to overfishing and battery fish farms. UK to work with Global organisations to tackle this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
Fishing vessels use thirty-mile fishing lines with baited hooks, 300,000 dolphins, whales and porpoises are killed yearly. 3.9 billion acres of seafloor is deforested yearly by trawling.46% of the pacific garbage patch is comprised of fishing nets. Fish farming is associated with infectious diseases and welfare abuses. Sustainable fishing is corrupt. 

The seas are most powerful carbon sinks in the world and most important support system for life on earth and preventing climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you're concerned about fishing, but we're not sure what you'd like the Government to work to change. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Install EV chargers at all petrol stations to improve adoption of electric cars
attributes.background:
The UK’s inadequate Electric Vehicle charging network is deterring motorists from switching to EVs.

If drivers knew that where there’s petrol there’s a charger, they’d be more comfortable with owning an EV.

Let’s install EV chargers at every petrol station to accelerate the switch to electric.
attributes.additional_details:
Other benefits of this proposal are:

*Guarantees EV charger network has full UK coverage
*Familiarity of petrol stations will be reassuring to drivers
*Introduces more competitors, which benefits consumers
*More cost effective strategy than roadside/parking bay chargepoints
*Solves many problems that unattended chargepoints have
*Petrol stations remain relevant, jobs are saved
*Oil companies fossil fuel profits go towards fighting climate change
*Utilises petrol retailers knowledge & experience

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for station owners. 

You could start a petition calling for the Government to find more EV charging points across the country, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Stop the deep coal mine in Cumbria
attributes.background: The plans to build this mine is against the Paris Climate agreement. The government needs to intervene and stop this from happening.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is real and its already impacting the world and the plan to erect this mine is going to go against all environmental agreements the government has opted into.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568475

attributes.action: Continue the ban on insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on all crops.
attributes.background: We ask that the recent decision to allow the use of the insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on sugarbeet is reversed.  It isn't allowed in the European Union and should not be used here either. We were promised there would be no lowering of environmental standards as part of Brexit changes.
attributes.additional_details:
Bees & other insects are proven to be hurt by neonicotinoids. They are also threatened by climate change & pollution.  
Insects are vital for a healthy environment, including for growing food.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: To legislate to ban the burning and mismanagement of grouse moors.
attributes.background: To draw upon the clear evidence available that such practices are harmful so that a legal ban is justified.
attributes.additional_details:
Natural England's Voluntary Code of Practice has not worked and so there is a need for a statutory ban. 

Further, legislation is needed to restore Peatlands to help combat Climate Change as the Government’s Climate Change Committee has recommended..

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the burning of peatlands and management of grouse moors, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make.

We have already published a petition calling on the Government to ban the burning of peatlands, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552993

If you would also like the Government to impose new restrictions on the management of grouse moors you could start a new petition about this, but it would need to be clear what you want the Government to do.

attributes.action: Lower tuition fees because of covid
attributes.background: We want the government to make it mandatory for universities to lower the tuition fees. No matter what, online teaching will never live up to the standard of face to face teaching and the experience that students are getting currently is very poor. It is unfair for students to have to day full fees.
attributes.additional_details: It is understandable that in this current climate many things have had to change, but students should not have to pay full prices when they are missing out on so much. Universities that are charging the full amount are not doing so in good interest and cannot say that the experiences that they are providing are anywhere near as good as before. Whilst this is not their fault they can make the gestures of acknowledging their courses are not up to previous standards and reducing costs.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

attributes.action: reward businesses for being environmentally friendly
attributes.background: give rewards like drop tax or encourage people to use businesses who focus on having low levels of pollution and/or plastic waste.
attributes.additional_details: climate change is a huge problem that will affect everyone and many big businesses put lots of pollution into the world and put lots of waste into the world with businesses producing many items with excessive plastic wrapping and with much of this going to waste. along with plastic needing 1000s of years to decompose. our seas filling with plastic and killing many animals and the planet. businesses that work to stop themselves from having high pollution and dropping plastic waste should be rewarded by the government. they should also be recognised and people should be made aware of businesses that work to do this to try and encourage the UK public to shop sustainably.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal

attributes.action: Prioritise a green transformation in the COVID-19 economic recovery plan
attributes.background:
People want an urgent response to the climate emergency. We have now seen that rapid action in times of crisis is possible. 

Let’s use the COVID-19 pandemic as a turning point in climate action, combining economic recovery with sustainable climate policy. 

The time for action is now.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to step up their commitment to people and our environment.

The evidence is clear: implementing green policies is the best way to revive the economy and tackle climate change.

With all of our futures thrown into question by the pandemic, now is the best time to re-prioritise and build back better.

We’ve consolidated expert research on the most impactful measures to achieve a sustainable and thriving economy. 

Visit: Peoplesplan.org

attributes.action: Promote natural reusable produce bags for fresh (non-packaged) foods.
attributes.background: Supermarket fresh produce is accompanied by scales and plastic bags, framed in a way to promote plastic use. Gov endorsement of natural reusable bags ie mesh bags will reduce the incentive to use plastic. The plastic bag fee has proved effective; It is time to take this a step further.
attributes.additional_details: Shops can provide these for free or sell these bags at a lower price than the 10p plastic alternatives, say 5p, to encourage the substitute. The government should promote these (adverts, news articles). The government could subsidise the provision of natural bags through a proportional increase in the plastic bag tax. The effective nudge to reduce plastic consumption is evidence this intervention can be effective. People are demanding climate change action- this policy is a positive step.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to support the use of reusable bags, but it's not clear exactly what action you want the Government to take to achieve this. It's not clear if you want the Government to run a campaign promoting the use of reusable bags, make changes to current charges, or impose additional requirements on retailers.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152

You could start a new petition about this issue, provided it is clear what action you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Prioritise a green economic and environmental recovery following coronavirus

Speed up legislation addressing climate change
Consult relevant organisations about far-reaching solutions
Stop supporting companies and projects that pollute the environment e.g. HS2.

Put people before profit and change our ways of thinking and acting.

attributes.background:

•Create sustainability jobs
•Extend & incentivise walking & cycling zones
•Support & incentivise sustainable food, farming & fishing
•Pass environmental laws & bring in targets in law to restore ecosystems

attributes.action: COVID-19 economic rescue plans must be green
attributes.background:
Coronavirus and climate change are the biggest challenges facing a generation.

Emergency financing must be used to build a sustainable economy which supports our health and wellbeing and drives growth, providing new jobs and opportunities across the UK for our generation and those of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2019, Parliament declared a climate change emergency. 

The government committed to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, pledging investment in clean energy solutions and green infrastructure and forecasting that the low carbon economy ‘could grow 11 per cent per year between 2015 and 2030, four times faster than the projected growth of the economy as a whole’.

The government must invest emergency funds in green and reproductive sectors including health, social care and public services.

attributes.action: The Government should subsidize Green Technology e.g. Electric Cars
attributes.background: The Government should help businesses that help the planet to grow. Money should be given to help them do more to tackle climate change. Electric Cars are an example.
attributes.additional_details: Climate Change needs to be dealt with and this is a way to do it. Taking the Electric Cars example, car pollution is a big thing and electric cars will take more petrol cars off the roads. Wind Turbines and Solar Panels should also be subsidized to build more renewable energy for the UK.

rejection.details: https://www.gov.uk/plug-in-vehicle-grants

attributes.action: Help stop the destruction of the Amazon Forest!
attributes.background:
Thousands of animals get killed each day by the destruction of the Amazon Forest. People burn it down to make way for cattle and land.
The new president, Jair Bolsonaro, isn’t helping matters. With the support of the Brazilian government, the fires have been growing. This needs to end.
attributes.additional_details: Deforestation is one of the biggest sources of carbon dioxide. Without the Amazon, defeating climate change will be impossible. We have already cut down 17% of the forest, scientists have predicted that by 2030 it will be 27%. Some of the indigenous people have been killed trying to stop the burning of their home. I demand England help stop this devastating destruction.

attributes.action: DO NOT delay ANY carbon-reduction commitments on the journey to Net Zero 2050
attributes.background: Delivering Net Zero CARBON EMISSIONS by 2050 is a tough target. Notwithstanding all other pressures, this is the highest priority for our Nation's wellbeing and prosperity. Pressing actions must be taken NOW and continue WITH URGENCY throughout 2022-2050 to comply with the Environment Law (Nov 2021)
attributes.additional_details:
Less than 0.2% of the electorate voted for Liz Truss as PM. We DO NOT TRUST her pledge to 'ensure opportunity and prosperity for all people and future generations' as she diverts wildly from the commitments that elected this government into office.
Specifically, any redirection of post-CAP Land Management Scheme (ELMS) financing, designated to consolidate a long-term vision to revitalise natural resources, our land base and our agronomy will be welcoming climate change catastrophy. What a legacy

rejection.details:
We understand you would like to see the Government fulfil it's commitments to the 2050 net zero target for carbon emissions and not delay, but the target is set out in law and the Government have not outlined any changes or delay to that year as the target.

You could start a new petition which explains clearly which specific actions you would like the Government to take to achieve the 2050 target.

We currently have the below petition open on a similar theme, which you might like to sign:

Bring forward the Net Zero emissions target to 2030
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616392

attributes.action: Support Farmers and Fishermen to Produce only Vegan Food and Care for Animals
attributes.background: Each year, around 80 million fish and 1.2 billion land animals are killed to be eaten in the UK alone each year. Worldwide, 77 billion land animals and around 1 trillion to 2.8 trillion fish are killed each year. This has to stop. We all need to go vegan, for the planet and the animals!
attributes.additional_details:
Everyone should go vegan to stop animal slaughter. We also need to try to make a vegan world possible without having to kill any remaining animals, and keep a vastly smaller number of farm animals around. They could be cared for in refuges.
 We also need to rewild as much of the rest of the land as possible, to help restore our planet, tackle climate change and save wildlife. If it weren’t for animal agriculture, it would also be easier to reintroduce native predators like wolves and bears.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to support a shift to veganism, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do. We could accept a petition calling on the Government withdraw all financial support for animal agriculture and fisheries, but it's not clear how fishermen could be involved in producing vegan food.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

The Vegan Petition - Ban Animal Agriculture and Animal Products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614487

attributes.action: Grants for Allotmenteers to reduce cost of growing and help climate change
attributes.background:
Remove any allotment rent charges councils are imposing 
Provide free compost to allotment holders from recycling facilities 
Collaborate with seed companies to distribute seeds to allotmenteers free of charge 
Income tax grants for Allotment expenses
attributes.additional_details:
The world puts about 10 billion metric tons of carbon in the air each year, much of it gets drawn down by oceans and plants. That’s why May is the peak for global carbon dioxide emissions. Plants in the northern hemisphere start sucking up more carbon dioxide in the summer as they grow.
Allotmenteers are helping to fight the excess CO2 emissions by growing but it is becoming a very expensive hobby with the cost of everthing going up. A bag of compost starts from £5 and goes up to £10.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about charges for allotments and services provided to allotment holders are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to provide grants to people holding allotments, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Net Zero. PM to hold a full independent enquiry focusing on economic outcomes.
attributes.background:
Whilst there appears to be a change to the world climate, we in the UK are one of the smallest contributors to emissions.

We are in danger of bankrupting our country, while the larger nations, China and India, continue as they are, causing pollution, which makes our efforts pointless.
attributes.additional_details:
In ceasing to use our own coal and gas, we are importing inferior coal and gas from other countries. This is imported using ships and road transport. This of course, is increasing the very footprint that we are claiming to reduce. While we grow poorer by doing this, other countries continue to pollute and become richer.
We should continue to use our own fuels and explore the possibilities of alternatives, such as building smaller power plants, such as suggested by James Dyson. We can then navigate our way to reducing emissions in a sensible way.

Insisting that we all throw away our efficient gas boilers is not the answer.

We would like an urgent enquiry taking all aspects into account, followed by a debate in parliament and, if necessary, a referendum.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure if you want an inquiry on the "economic outcomes" of Net Zero or "all aspects"

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or you might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Allow those 16+ to vote in the next General Election
attributes.background:
Messy Brexit. A pandemic. Climate change. It's clear 16 year olds aren't the ones with issues voting. With an uncertain future, let's all have a say in it. Most in their later teens are citizens who contribute either economically or socially. So let those 
16+ vote in the next general election.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598399

attributes.action: Request the Court to set up a panel to evaluate all evidence of climate change
attributes.background: To examine the IPCC reports together with other organisations in the spectrum
attributes.additional_details: The costs and other aspects of the green agenda are currently being publicly critically questioned because there has never been a proper public democratic or parliamentary debate. As a result, there is now much confusion due to the confusing claims. An independent erudite report should promote better-informed discussion.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Judicial inquiries and any panels set up to evaluate them are a matter for the courts and not the UK Government and Parliament. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Establish Cabinet Office Briefing Rooms (COBR) for the climate emergency.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has been a global leader in the past and we have the opportunity to show real leadership to tackle the climate change crisis, biodiversity loss and pollution of nature and the impacts on or own health and well being.  We need emergency action and planning establishing COBR.
attributes.additional_details: The government has declared a climate emergency and the science is screaming at us we have to change now, as an emergency. COP 26 has just about kept "1.5" alive, but we need action. COBR is required to bring the planners, military strategists, business, individuals, innovators, and government together to set the plan to tackle the crisis and tell the world we are acting post COP 26 and listening to the public. Committees are not the answer for an emergency, we need action right now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Government action on climate change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

COBR (or COBRA) is shorthand for the Civil Contingencies Committee that is convened to handle matters of national emergency or major disruption, and the briefing rooms referred to in the acronym are located in Whitehall.

There are already Cabinet Committees on Climate Action Strategy and Climate Action Implementation, but we could accept a petition calling on the Government to schedule COBR meetings to address the climate emergency, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Bring the date for the net-zero target closer.
attributes.background: Make the net-zero target date closer so that we can foresee that period of time more easily. We have no idea what will happen in 29 years and this is a target where we can't say exactly what that time will be like. I want parliament to take action, to restore our planet for now and for the future.
attributes.additional_details: In a recent live chat during the COP26 event, we were informed that climate change is like a boulder, when it reaches that top of the hill it'll roll by itself all the way down the other side and we won't be able to stop it. This means that damage will be caused uncontrollably, without us being able to make a difference. We don't know where this boulder is, if it is on the edge, we need to act now, we don't know whether it is here or not, therefore, we need to act as soon as it is possible.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the current target for reducing the UK's carbon emissions to zero, but it's not clear how much you want this to be brought forward by.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government to change this target to, or we could accept a petition calling on the Government to review the current net zero target date.

attributes.action: Open debate prior to Referendum on Climate Change and Britain's future role.
attributes.background: Told spend trillions of pounds on a system that some say will not work is more authoritarian than democratic.  We therefore wish to have an open debate on how Britain can become green,& hear evidence from scientists/organisations who dispute the emergence of any Climate Change and then a Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
UK is only responsible for 1% of carbon emissions globally; rank #17 in the World; therefore would it not be beneficial to see countries such as India, China & Russia etc at the forefront of change before Britain commits?
Many people are unconvinced by proposals to turn Britain carbon neutral and would prefer to have their say on the issue.  After hearing debates from both sides of the argument on Climate Change, we would then ask for a Referendum on how we proceed in making Britain greener

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the referendum to be a decision on. You might like to sign this petition instead

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

If you do start a new petition, you'll need to use a real name.

attributes.background:
To examine the IPCC reports together with other organisations 
 in the spectrum
attributes.additional_details: The costs and other aspects of the green agenda are currently being questioned because there has never been a proper public democratic or parliamentary debate. An independent erudite report should promote better-informed discussion.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Judicial reviews are a matter for the courts and not the UK Government and Parliament. Otherwise, we're not sure what you'd like a 'judicial inquiry' to involve. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reverse the cuts, and increase investment in Public Transport.
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand that Baroness Vere, and the Government, increase investment in our Public Transport network, and halt all plans to cut the budget from 27.42 million to less than 9 million.
attributes.additional_details: The current budget has resulted in less subsidy for transport providers, higher fares and loss of services; unfairly hitting those with lower incomes, senior citizens, non drivers, students, residents of rural areas, and anyone with disabilities/poor mobility; reducing both access to and positive outcomes in, medical care, employment, education and training opportunities.  To cut deeper still flies in the face of the Government's aims to 'Level Up', 'Bus Back Better', 'Tackle Climate Change',

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand you're concerned about funding for public transport, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do, for example providing additional funding to local authorities to invest in local public transport.

attributes.action: End Capitalism to Save the Climate.
attributes.background: Form a new economic system on private ownership and change the need for a pure focus of profit for companies and reduce their need for accumulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The unequivocal evidence shows us how the existence and persistence of Capitalism will ensure the downfall of the human race. Capitalism needs to end as it poses a serious threat to the world through how it exploits every resource. Individuals being allowed to exploit natural resources purely for economic wealth is a flawed ideal.

We only have one planet, we must consider the natural capacity of its resources and reduce climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the climate, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Cancel the Cambo oilfield and Cumbria coalmine projects ahead of COP26
attributes.background: The UK government, as the head of this years COP26 conference in Glasgow, should cancel the Cambo oilfield and Cumbria coalmine projects. By doing this, it maintains a continued priority on ending fossil fuel extraction and use in this country and abroad, reducing GHG emissions as a result.
attributes.additional_details: The 2021 IPCC report clearly shows the importance of ending the use of fossil fuels as a means for energy worldwide before 2030. The consequences of fossil fuel emissions are blatant both from this report, and from what’s happening around the world today. Flash floods, wildfires, rising sea levels - these are all a result of human-accelerated climate change, and if the UK government continues with oil and coal extraction this decade, they will damage the planet further beyond repair.

rejection.details:
Consent to proceed to production at Cambo filed will be a matter for the UK's regulators, the Oil and Gas Authority (OGA), and the Offshore Petroleum Regulator for Environment and Decommissioning (OPRED), following their standard regulatory processes.

The planning decision regarding approval for Cumbria Coal Mine has been called in by the UK Government, and will be subject to a public inquiry: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/968840/Call_in_letter_lpa_redacted.pdf

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Set a maximum working temperature for workplaces where the work itself allows it
attributes.background: Set a maximum working temperature by law at workplaces where the work itself doesn't require a specific temperature (e.g. cooling units, certain food factories, foundries, etc).
attributes.additional_details: As this summer shows again, we cannot ignore anymore that climate change affects workplaces as much as anything else. There's tens of thousands of people working in factories and warehouses, where maximum temperature at summer can reach a 35-40 celsius indoor (depending of the structure and the condition of the building). It's not only uncomfortable, but also a health risk. We're all have different tolerance of heat, but none of us can stand 35 celsius for 8 hours for days.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the below petition which is currently open on this topic:

Set a legal maximum temperature for all indoor workplaces
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588186

attributes.action: Conserve and protect wildlife by reducing single use plastics in packaging.
attributes.background: Encourage use of recyclable materials rather than single use plastics in packaging. Limit the amount of single use plastics suppliers can use as well as making it compulsory to display the plastic's lifetime on the packaging. Provide more information on the benefits of recycling.
attributes.additional_details: Our local area is the epicenter littering and plastic waste and we as an NCS team want to do something about it. For too long, we young people have had to walk through plastic filled streets and past overflowing bins. This has had a catastrophic impact on wildlife in the city as well as the rural areas near to us. With climate change an ever present problem, we want to become NCS change makers in our local community and we want you to be a part of our plans.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

Ban packaging that is not biodegradable or domestically recyclable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574939

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

attributes.action: Make published Carbon Footprint a key factor prior to any bilateral trade deals.
attributes.background: Explicitly and transparently publish carbon footprint comparisons of all bilateral trade deals. Citizens need to be made aware of how serious the Government is in meeting global emissions/temperature reduction targets. UK Parliamentarians to debate it and British public made aware of the outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Public knowledge and debate about carbon footprints can help save our planet together. The role of Australian beef in the deal currently under review is an example of no apparent consideration of this being done. UK farmers will be undercut at a high cost - global warming! The carbon footprint of beef production anywhere is extremely high but transporting meat from long distance sources creates a much higher carbon footprint and is extremely detrimental to global warming and climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the carbon footprint of trade partners, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "carbon footprint comparisons of all bilateral trade deals", but it's not clear what you want these publications to set out, or what, if any, other actions you want the Government to take to make this a "key factor".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Say no to consett incinerator
attributes.background:
We want the government to stop Durham county council agreeing to the building of an incinerator to burn waste within the Consett area .
Ref. DM/20/03267/WAS
attributes.additional_details: Incinerators harm recycling; our air quality and contribute to climate change. Enmisions include dioxins, Box and ultrafine particulate matter that can be harmful to both human health and the natural environment, there is not enough monitoring, enforcement or transpararency by the industry. Traffic will increase having 22 HGV movements per day carrying waste in and out across the North East adding more pollution. A 50 meter stack will be much higher than any building in the area, therefore the night and industrial nature of this incinerator will cause substantial,adverse and permanent visual effects bringing unacceptable harm and retirement to the character of the landscape.

rejection.details: The decision on this planning application is a matter for Durham County Council, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Make loose fruit and veg cheaper than fruit and veg in plastic.
attributes.background: The fruit and veg wrapped in plastic is cheaper than the loose fruit and veg. This needs to be changed so that people will buy the loose fruit and veg resulting in our consumption of plastic being reduced. Some countries are already doing this. Why can't we?
attributes.additional_details: We are living in a climate crisis. If we do not make the changes necessary then humanity may not survive the consequences. Before the 1950s nothing in shops was wrapped in plastic meaning that it is possible and we can do it again. This would just be one step to becoming a more sustainable society and stopping the destruction of our planet and ourselves. The plastic that is destroying our oceans and wildlife eventually gets back to us and negatively impacts our health. This is effecting us too.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for retailers.

You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577169

attributes.action: Allow Universities to de-platform speakers on certain conditions
attributes.background: The government's proposed "free-speech" legislation for Univerisites will have the effect of abolishing standards of decency and truthfulness for visiting speakers. Universities should be allowed to de-platform speakers on certain conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should allow Universities do de-platform a speaker whose views are either highly bigoted or anti-factual. 

The IHRA definition of antisemitism is a great place to start with this. If a visiting speaker is found to exhibit this kind of bigotry against Jews or any other ethnic or religious group then it should be within the write of a Univeristy to de-platform them.  

Tying into this is my point about anti-factual speakers. If a speaker is found to be spreading misinformation about the truth of the holocaust or the scientific consenus for climate change then allowing them to speak at a University makes as much sense as a flat-Earther at a geography convention. It should be within the right of a University to de-platform them.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It's not clear what you mean by 'highly bigoted or anti-factual views'.

If there are specific exemptions or changes to the Government's proposals on free speech and academic freedom at universities which you'd like to see happen, you could start a new petition calling for those exemptions or changes.

You might also like to sign the following petition:

Do not impose new free speech conditions on higher education
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575600

attributes.action: Create a duty to account for the impacts of government decisions on children
attributes.background: Create a binding duty that allows children, regardless of socio-economic background, to be fully and equally represented in core government decision making relating to health, environment and wellbeing, particularly where the results have potential to widen intergenerational inequality.
attributes.additional_details: In the context of Covid-19 children have had no voice in decision making. Yet this will affect their education, wellbeing, and their future prospects as economically active citizens. The proposed mitigation strategies are woefully inadequate, and children themselves are not being consulted about shaping their own futures post-Covid. Similarly with climate change, children have no right to representation in decision making that affects the sustainability of the future, which is largely theirs.

rejection.details:
Section 149 of the Equality Act 2010 sets out the Public Sector Equality Duty, which requires public authorities, including Government departments and Ministers, to have due regard to several equality considerations, including age, when exercising their functions. As this duty places expectations on the Government to consider the impact of their policies on children, among other groups at risk of socio-economic disadvantage, it is not clear what action you would like the Government to take.

You can find out more about the Public Sector Equality Duty here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn06591/.

As this duty requires public authorities to simply have 'due regard' to such considerations, you could start a petition calling on the Government to strengthen this requirement by enacting the Public Sector Duty and associated Equality Impact Assessments as law, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to seek public authorisation for  Net-Zero Climate Policies.
attributes.background: In order to ensure the broadest possible consent for widespread & far reaching climate policies a referendum be held where everyone over the age of 16 should be eligible and there would need to be a two thirds majority of the electorate ( not turnout ) to authorise the pursuit of Net Zero policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The stated policies to date are  uncosted & unpublished by H M Government and reliant on information and statements from political rather than scientific bases. The “science” on climate change is not settled as is borne out by several hundred, peer reviewed, scientific papers published over the last five years. 
Unless the public are made aware of the immediate and long term effects of Net-Zero, the political and societal repercussions could result in widespread unrest throughout the UK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Government hasn't yet published its net zero strategy or set out exactly what policies it will pursue in order to reach its net zero target, so we're not sure exactly which policies you'd like to see considered in a referendum.

You could start a new petition calling for a referendum on the principle of the UK pursuing policies in order to achieve net zero carbon emissions, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Ban all non-essential and non-biodegradable single use plastic wrapping
attributes.background: Implement a prohibition on the use of non-biodegradable single-use plastic wrapping for everything except items for which there is no alternative. Reusable wrappings such as zip bags could potentially still be allowed. Obviously industry would need some years warning to adapt - period to be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Whereas it has taken mankind about 200,000 years to overrun the planet, and our heavy burning of fossil fuels about 200 years to start changing the climate, plastics have infested every part of our planet in a mere 50 years or so. They aren't going away - with the exception of some very specialised bacteria, nature cannot deal with plastics. We became the top species without them and can manage without them again; meats can once again be wrapped in greaseproof paper, etc.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

attributes.action: Don't Ban petrol and diesel cars, it won't save the planet.
attributes.background: Review the true facts and stop this false Green campaign against cars
attributes.additional_details:
• Banning petrol and diesel vehicles worldwide would deliver only 0.4% emissions savings at a vast cost to the taxpayer.
• Climate change doesn’t care about where CO2 comes from. Personal cars are only about 7 per cent of global emissions, and electric cars will only help a little.
• The hybrid car saves about the same amount of CO2 as an electric car over its lifetime.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/11/17/dont-expect-electric-cars-save-planet/

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556842

attributes.action: Amend the Building Regulations Act 2010 to make Solar PV Panels mandatory.
attributes.background: We the Undersigned want the government to amend the Building Regulations Act 2010 to make it mandatory for all new build domestic and commercial properties to be fitted with Solar Photovoltaic Panels as standard.
attributes.additional_details: In order to achieve goals on carbon emissions the UK must decrease use of non-renewable fossil fuels. Harnessing the energy provided by the sun through the implementation of Solar PV panels will assist with this. While the widespread use of Solar PV panels and the subsequent saving on energy bills for the occupiers would reduce some of the financial burden on the 22% of the UK population living in poverty. As well as creating employment opportunities and helping minimise climate change.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

attributes.action: Put David Attenborough on the £50 note (& change the colour to aquamarine).
attributes.background: The climate crisis is very evident and to honour Sir David Attenborough's life-long dedication to the environment, wildlife and marine life, he should be honoured further for this by being the face of the new £50 note.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make this change because Sir David is the most influential climate & wildlife activist in the world. His work has been shown across the globe & he is dearly loved for his powerful messages by all. By having the UK put Sir David's face on the £50 note, you will not only be recognising his dedication but you will send the world an important message that individuals like Sir David must be honoured, supported and recognised. Especially in light of the climate crisis.

rejection.details:
Bank notes are the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how the Bank decides who will be on bank notes here:
https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/banknote-characters

attributes.action: Change the senior team for COP26, to include women.
attributes.background: Yesterday's article in the Guardian, states that all senior politicians, civil servants and negotiators to represent Britain at next year’s COP26 talks are men. We want the government to change the line-up, so that the UK top team includes both male and female representatives.
attributes.additional_details:
In the words of Ruth Bader Ginsberg “Women belong in all places where decisions are being made." And this is never more true than on the subject of climate change, where women throughout the world are among those worst hit by climate breakdown.

UN Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres recently stated that gender equality (UN SDG5), is the prerequisite for a better world, and yet the government is demonstrating a flagrant disregard for it, with the choice of a male-only senior team at COP26.

attributes.action: Block high carbon footprinters from powerful situations regarding society.
attributes.background: Bring in new legislation that blocks all contributions or persuasions of the climate change and carbon footprint topic from people with high carbon footprints. This is a necessary step towards preventing the super rich from depriving ordinary people of the right to live and enjoy their lives.
attributes.additional_details: Throughout human history, the super-rich have always loathed the poor and resented their existence and use of finite materials, land and food, and criticised them for their production of waste and desire for free-time, recreational wanderings and even the carbon dioxide they exhale and emit. Therefore, high carbon producing people should not have the power to determine population control, society design or civil liberties. Giving them power over these policies is like giving them a loaded gun.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions that make a clear request by the Government.

We understand that you are concerned about decision-making in the UK, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do about this. Your petition refers to decision making over policies, but doesn't make clear who you think should be prevented from from making these decisions, or what decision-making roles you think such people should be prevented from holding. Your petition also appears to conflate wealth with carbon footprints.

attributes.action: Stop trade with Brazil until they end deforestation of the Amazon Rainforest
attributes.background: Put sanctions on the Brazilian government until they get deforestation under control.
attributes.additional_details: The amazon produces 20% of all oxygen and it needs protection to help with battling climate change

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323657

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to appoint Tony Abbott as trade adviser to UK government.
attributes.background: Don't appoint him as his views on women (the majority in the UK for many years according to national census data), climate change (absolutely key in any trade negotiations as I understand it) and LGBT rights do not represent the values of the UK.
attributes.additional_details: See above.

rejection.details: We can’t accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for someone to lose their job.

attributes.action: Make sure at least 55% of UK plastic is recycled compared to the current 30%.
attributes.background: I want it ensured that when we are told things are being recycled, they are recycled and not just a third of it is recycled. This gives people a false sense of hope that they are fighting climate change when in reality, NOTHINGS CHANGING!
attributes.additional_details: Because we need to save our planet and all the renewable energy in the world isn't going to change the fact that if we don't act, plastic will be on the planet for 1000 years. The government has to increase the amount of plastic we use to at least 55%.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make 'Sustainability' a compulsory GCSE on the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sustainability should be compulsory for all students and will ascertain the same GCSE certificate as any other subject. The emphasis and resources associated  with the new sustainability course should be in line with all over other subjects currently classes as “core subjects”
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is the most prominent and potentially fatal crisis of the modern age, it must be tackled head on with affirmative action but this alone will not prevail in reversing a climate catastrophe. At the forefront of the fight against climate change must be education of the masses to comprehensively change our planet depleting habitual traits.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300279

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: After Coronavirus, invest in green and clean industries to stimulate the economy
attributes.background: Economic stimulus after Coronavirus should prioritise green and clean energy industries. Examples with high employment opportunities include better home insulation, tree planting, investment in railways and electric car charging points. Please don’t bailout the airline or fossil fuel industries.
attributes.additional_details:
After Coronavirus there will need to be heavy investment in the UK, in order to restart our economy. This should take the form of a Green New Deal - https://www.greennewdealuk.org/
This is a reset moment for the global economy. The pandemic has shown us that extreme changes are possible and fast when lives are at risk. Lives are at risk from climate change.
Let us use this moment to keep making bold choices and get to a zero carbon economy faster together.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:
Protect the Environment – support carbon neutral energy alternatives:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

You may also wish to sign these petitions:
Decline any requests for bailouts from the airline industry:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302992

Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178
